column4: i just downloaded a .patch file for bitlbee, how do i apply it?
What was the source., i.e. where did the deb or pkg come from?
i installed bitlbee from synaptic
Should just install correctly then
but i downloaded the patch separately.... not from synaptic
how should i "install" the patch?
Ah, ok, that is why I asked what was the source, I would not. I would look for the correct .deb or pkg that works or is designed to work with the current or running kernel.
for bitlbee? i don't think bitlbee has something to do with the kernel
Versions matter, some stuff works on ### and some does not, yet. or never will.
i'm looking in synaptic, but can't find the patch i downloaded
That is where I was headed, it may not work with the version. Let me look at the deb packages.
ok thanks
What version Ubuntu are you using now?
Here is the BIG list. http://packages.ubuntu.com/ and here is 9.10: http://packages.ubuntu.com/karmic/ But look at the Big List because it may be a backport.
ah, ok thanks; i'll give it a look
You are very welcome, I am still looking for that package though.
i don't think it's on the repositories, it's just a patch
i can just find other plugins, but not exactly the one i am looking for
Is it a deb?
the ones i found where debs, yes, and they are on synaptic too. The one i downloaded is a .patch
http://ubuntuforums.org/search.php?searchid=71031341 That is the Forum , still looking
thanks, i hope i can find something about the bitlbee msn patch i'm looking for
You are very welcome, I hope that Forum page helps.
